page.title: 17THE RIDGEWAY - PRINT WOOD.
page.content: In the{Offchurch}area the southern part of the{Ridgeway}runs northwards from the{Grand Union Canal}to the once {gated road to Long Itchington. }The track varies in width from a narrow footpath to being wide enough for a tractor. It passes through a number of open fields of{wheat, rape and {barley. Where it passes through{Print Wood the soil is obviously clay and it can be wet and muddy even in very dry weather. A wide variety of trees line the path especially{oak, beech, {hawthorn, field maple}and a large quantity of{elm}which is dead, killed by Dutch Elm Disease. There is a wide variety of plant life all along the route.{Wild roses are especially abundant.
